name: sfchronicle
text:
300,000 people have died from COVID-19.

That is the entire city of Pittsburgh. It is half the number of Americans who have died from AIDS since 1983.

It has led us to consider how we bury our dead this year ‚Äî as a society, and as individuals.
https://t.co/n4DVBCCsX4
